channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16217] Identify calling user in ObserverContext
item.description: We already either explicitly pass down the relevant User instance initiating an action through the call path, or it is available through RpcServer.getRequestUser(). We should carry this through in the ObserverContext for coprocessor upcalls and make use of it for permissions checking.

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment:
The attached patch is a first step in eliminating use of UserGroupInformation.doAs() for permissions checking:

  • adds a User instance to ObserverContext identifying the calling user for the coprocessor context
  • updates AccessController to make use of this for permissions checks
  • eliminates use of UserGroupInformation.doAs() for permissions checks in procedure paths, compactions, splits, region merges
Also posted patch on review board: https://reviews.apache.org/r/49970/

-1 overall
